This type is used by an entity .

An A3m_equivalence_criterion_for_shape is a type of . This entity plays a role of a root node among all the criterion entities defined in this standard. It is an abstract supertype of , , and . It implies that criteria for the equivalence validation of shape data is classified into three categories; validation by representative property value, by data structure, and by detailed data content.
Various criteria are prepared under
entity as its subtypes for checking equivalence of shape data. Those criteria use representative property such as bounding box, centroid, volume, number of entities, etc.
Major focus of the validation by data structure is appropriateness of the correspondence of the two shape data inspected. Criteria for detecting merged data, split data, and removed data, etc. are prepared under
entity as its subtypes for checking the equivalence from data structural point of view.
Major focus of the validation by detailed data content is to check whether spatial extent of two shape data is identical within given tolerance. Criteria for checking equivalence of spatial extent of two B-rep data, whether or not continuity is kept equivalent, whether or not point set are on the target connected curve or surface within tolerance, etc. are prepared under
entity as its subtypes.
NOTE 1 Criteria under
are prepared for rough check of the equivalence of two models. Criteria under
are prepared for the most detailed check of the equivalence of two models. Even if no inequivalence is detected by the criteria under
and those under , inequivalence may be detected by some criterion under . It is designed that the user can freely select appropriate criteria in appropriate order for the equivalence validation of the two models in his concern.
NOTE 2 The inspected models are basically entire manifold_solid_brep, however its subset, such as connected_face_set, connected_edge_set, and point_cloud_dataset may also appear as the inspection target models.

An A3m_equivalence_criterion_of_detailed_shape_data_content is a type of
and is an abstract supertype of the entities for detecting detailed geometric instance level inequivlaence of two partial or entire models.

An A3m_equivalence_criterion_of_representative_shape_property_value is a type of
and is an abstract supertype of the entities for detecting inequivalence of two models
using representative property values of the target models, which are obtained by global geometric calculations. The insepected models can be represented by shell_based_wireframe_model, shell_based_surface_model, connected_edge_set, connected_face_set, or manifold_solid_brep.
Representative properties such as bounding box, centroid, volume, surface area, etc. calculated by the original CAD system are frequently attached to the exchange file. Use of them in the equivalence validation of two models shall be judged with enough care since they are meaningful in some limited circumstances when they were calculated.
comparing and compared element type names shall be the same.

An A3m_equivalence_criterion_of_shape_data_structure is a type of
and is an abstract supertype of the entities for checking topological coincidence of two connected_face_set's. It is assumed that two models compared are closely located and have similar spatial extent by passing
test.
comparing and compared element type names shall be the same.

A Different_bounding_box is a type of
that asserts that bounding boxes of two compared shape entities are different. The inspection requirement corresponding to this entity is to calculate bounding boxes of two given elements with specified accuracy, then to check if the difference of the boxes is larger than the given threshold. Requirements on the calculation of bounding boxes and those for detecting difference between two bounding boxes are as described below.
A bounding box of a shape model is a cuboid that contains it inside, all the edges of the bounding box are parallel to the axes of the model coordinate system. It is assumed that the bounding box is calculated by using all the vertices from the tessellated model of each shape entity in the model. Then the bounding box can be represented by two Cartesian points, one consists of minimum coordinate values and the other consists of maximum coordinate values. Suppose two bounding boxes A and B are given, and A is represented by two points Amin and Amax, and B by Bmin and Bmax, respectively. Calculate distance between Amin and Bmin, and also between Amax and Bmax. The two bounding boxes are considered to be different when either of the two distances are larger than the given threshold.
An example of bounding box is depicted in Figure 1.
Bounding box of a manifold solid brep represented by two points
numerical test to check if bounding boxes of two shape entities are different.
maximum deviation of the tessellated model, that is used for the calculation of the bounding box, from the precise model.
type name of the comparison target product data shall be either etns_manifold_solid_brep, etns_shell_based_surface_model, or etns_shell_based_wireframe_model.
type name of inspected value shall be mdns_length_measure. The inspected value according to this criterion shows the difference of two bounding boxes.
type name of detected difference shall be ddns_two_cartesian_points. The detected differences according to this criterion are minimum and maximum points of a bounding box calculated.
no accuracy is associated with this criterion.

The
of
by numerical test shall be of type
and its numerical value shall be of type specified by the measured_data_type attribute.

A Different_centroid is a type of
that asserts that centroids of two compared shape models are different. The inspection requirement corresponding to this entity is to calculate centroids of the two shape models, then to calculate the distance between them, and finally to check if the distance is larger than the given threshold.
numerical test to check if distance between the two centroids are larger than the threshold.
maximum deviation of the discretized model used for centroid calculation from the precise shape.
type name of the comparison target product data shall be either etns_manifold_solid_brep, etns_shell_based_surface_model, or etns_shell_based_wireframe_model.
type name of inspected value shall be mdns_length_measure. The inspected value according to this criterion shows the difference of the two centroids.
type name of detected difference shall be ddns_two_cartesian_points. The detected difference according to this criterion is calculated centroid for each element.
no accuracy is associated with this criterion.

The
of
by numerical test shall be of type
and its numerical value shall be of type specified by the measured_data_type attribute.

A Different_curve_length is a type of
that asserts that curve lengths of the two compared
are different. The inspection requirement corresponding to this entity is to calculate the sum of curve lengths of
with specified accuracy, and to check if the difference of the sums of the curve lengths is larger than the given threshold.
The target data connected_edge_set is expected to be constructed from B-rep, surface, or wireframe model.
numerical test to check if the difference of the sums of the curve length is larger than the threshold.
maximum deviation of the discretized shape used for curve length calculation from the original shape.
type name of the comparison target product data shall be etns_connected_edge_set.
type name of inspected value shall be mdns_length_measure. The inspected value according to this criterion shows the difference of the sums of the curve lengths.
type name of detected difference shall be ddns_length_measure. The detected difference according to this criterion is the sum of the curve lengths of each .
no accuracy is associated with this criterion.

The
for
of this entity shall be of type
and its numerical value shall be of type specified by the measured_data_type attribute.

A Different_number_of_closed_shell is a type of
that asserts the number of s in two compared s are different. The inspection requirement corresponding to this entity is to obtain the number of s in two compared s and to check if they are different.

logical test that tests if the number of
in two s are different.
type name of the comparison target product data shall be etns_manifold_solid_brep.
type name of inspected value shall be mdns_boolean_value. The inspected value according to this criterion is TRUE, if the number of s in two compared s are different.

type name of detected difference shall be ddns_count_measure. The detected difference according to this criterion is the number of
in each .
no accuracy is associated with this criterion.

A Different_number_of_geometric_elements is a type of
that asserts the number of geometric elements contributing for entire shape representation are different between two compared s or s. Here, geometric elements in consideration are ,
and . The inspection requirement corresponding to this entity is to obtain the number of three types of geometric elements described above in the two compared s or s, and to check if any of them are different or not.
logical test to check if the number of any geometric elements in consideration in the two s or s are different.
type name of the comparison target product data shall be either etns_manifold_solid_brep or etns_shell_based_surface_model.
type name of inspected value shall be mdns_boolean_value. The inspected value according to this criterion is TRUE, if the number of any geometric elements in consideration are different.

type name of detected difference shall be ddns_three_count_measure. The detected differences according to this criterion are number of , , and
in each
or .
no accuracy is associated with this criterion.

A Different_number_of_geometric_elements_wireframe_model is a type of
that asserts that the number of geometric elements are different between two compared shell_based_wireframe_models. Here, geometric elements in consideration are
and . The inspection requirement corresponding to this entity is to obtain the number of two types of geometric elements described above in the two compared shell_based_wireframe_models, and to check if any of them are different or not.
logical test to check if the numbers of any geometric elements in consideration in the two shell_based_wireframe_models are different.
type name of the comparison target product data shall be etns_shell_based_wireframe_model.
type name of inspected value shall be mdns_boolean_value. The inspected value according to this criterion is TRUE, if the number of any geometric elements are different.

type name of detected difference shall be ddns_two_count_measure. The detected differences according to this criterion are number of
and
in each shell_based_wireframe_model.
no accuracy is associated with this criterion.

A Different_number_of_topological_elements is a type of
that asserts the number of topological elements are different between two compared s or s. Here, topological elements in consideration are , , ,
and . The inspection requirement corresponding to this entity is to obtain the number of five types of topological elements described above in the two compared models
and to check if any of them are different or not.
Here, the Loop means not only internal boundary of Face, but also external boundary represented by edge_loop or vertex_loop. In a case of "cube" model, the number of Vertex, Edge, Face, Loop and Connected_face_set are 8, 12, 6, 6 and 1.
logical test to check if the number of any topological elements in the two models, s or s, are different.
type name of the comparison target product data shall be either etns_manifold_solid_brep or etns_shell_based_surface_model.
type name of inspected value shall be mdns_boolean_value. The inspected value according to this criterion is TRUE, if the number of any topological elements are different.

type name of detected difference shall be ddns_five_count_measure. The detected differences according to this criterion are number of , , ,
and
in each
or .
no accuracy is associated with this criterion.

A Different_number_of_topological_elements_wireframe_model is a type of
that asserts the number of topological elements are different between two shell_based_wireframe_model's. Here, topological elements in consideration are , ,
and shell (wire_shell and vertex_shell). The inspection requirement corresponding to this entity is to obtain the number of four types of topological elements described above in the two compared shell_based_wireframe_models, and to check if any of them are different or not.
logical test to check if the number of any topological elements in the two shell_based_wireframe_models are different.
type name of the comparison target product data shall be etns_shell_based_wireframe_model.
type name of inspected value shall be mdns_boolean_value. The inspected value according to this criterion is TRUE, if the number of any topological elements are different.

type name of detected difference shall be ddns_four_count_measure. The detected differences according to this criterion are the number of , ,
and shell (wire_shell and vertex_shell) in each shell_based_wireframe_model.
no accuracy is associated with this criterion.

A Different_surface_area is a type of
that asserts the surface areas of the two compared s are different. The inspection requirement corresponding to this entity is to calculate the surface areas of the two given s with specified accuracy, and to check if the difference of the surface areas is larger than the given threshold.
The target data type connected_face_set accepts partial or entire domain of B-rep model and surface model.
numerical test to check if the difference of surface areas are larger than the threshold.
maximum deviation of the discretized model used for surface area calculation from the precise shape of .
type name of the comparison target product data shall be etns_connected_face_set.
type name of inspected value shall be mdns_area_measure. The inspected value according to this criterion shows the difference of surface areas.
type name of detected difference shall be ddns_two_cartesian_points. The detected difference according to this criterion is the surface area of each .
no accuracy is associated with this criterion.

The
for
of this entity shall be of type
and its numerical value shall be of type specified by the measured_data_type attribute.

A Different_surface_normal is a type of
which detects the difference of unit normals at two corresponing points of the compared and comparing . Here, `A' stands for the compared model and `B' for the comparing model. The inspection requirement is as follows;
generate discretized region of B's faces as a set of points PBi (i = 1, 2, 3, ... ) with the specified density.
search the nearest point PAi on A's faces from each point PBi.
calculate unit normals as directions; VAi at PAi and VBi at PBi.
calculate the angle dVi between VAi and VBi.
compare the angle dVi with the given threshold.
if dVi exceeds the threshold, report a pair of points as ( PAi, PBi ).
conduct the above process by switching A and B.
The target data type connected_face_set accepts partial or entire domain of B-rep model and surface model.
numerical test to check if the difference of the unit normals is larger than the threshold.

a tolerance of
type for use in the discretization of , which sets an upper limit of the spatial distances between discretized points.
type name of the comparison target product data shall be etns_connected_face_set.
type name of the other comparison target product data shall be etns_connected_face_set.

type name of inspected value shall be mdns_plane_angle_measure. The inspected value according to this criterion shows the difference of the angle between two directions at the corresponding two points.
type name of detected difference shall be either ddns_cartesian_point or ddns_point_on_surface. The detected difference according to this criterion is calculated for each .

type name of accuracy shall be atns_length_measure. The accuracy is used to calculate the nearest point on a
from a discretized point.

The
of
of this entity shall be of type
and its numerical value shall be of type specified by the measured_data_type attribute.

A Different_volume is a type of
that asserts that volumes of the two compared s are different. The inspection requirement corresponding to this entity is to calculate the volumes of two given s with specified accuracy, and to check if the difference of the volumes is larger than the given threshold.
numerical test to check if the difference of the volumes are larger than the threshold.
maximum deviation of the discretized shape used for volume calculation from the original shape of .
type name of the comparison target product data shall be etns_manifold_solid_brep.
type name of inspected value shall be mdns_volume_measure. The inspected value according to this criterion shows the difference of two volumes.
type name of detected difference shall be ddns_volume_measure. The detected difference according to this criterion is the volume of each .
no accuracy is associated with this criterion.

The
of
of this entity shall be of type
and its numerical value shall be of type specified by the measured_data_type attribute.

A Mismatch_of_arcwise_connected_curves is a type of
which detects geometric difference between two compared s. Here, `A' stands for the compared model and `B' for the comparing model. The inspection requirement for this entity is as follows;
generate discretized region of B's edges as a set of points PBi (i = 1, 2, 3, ... ) with the specified density.
search for the nearest point PAi on A's edges from each point PBi, and calculate the distance Di between PAi and PBi.
compare the distance Di with the given threshold.
if Di exceeds the threshold, report a pair of points as ( PAi, PBi ).
repeat the above process by switching A and B.
The target data connected_edge_set is expected to be constructed from B-rep, surface, or wireframe model.
numerical test to check if the distance of the two corrsponding points is larger than the threshold.

a tolerance of
type for use in the discretization of , which sets an upper limit of the spatial distances between discretized points.
type name of the comparison target product data shall be etns_connected_edge_set.
type name of the other comparison target product data shall be etns_connected_edge_set.
type name of inspected value shall be mdns_length_measure. The inspected value according to this criterion shows the distance between two corresponding points.
type name of detected difference shall be either ddns_cartesian_point or ddns_point_on_curve. The detected difference according to this criterion is calculated for each .

type name of accuracy shall be atns_length_measure. The accuracy is used to calculate the nearest point on a
from a discretized point.

The
of
of this entity shall be of type
and its numerical value shall be of type specified by the measured_data_type attribute.

A Mismatch_of_arcwise_connected_surfaces is a type of
which detects the geometric difference between two compared s. Here, `A' stands for the compared model and `B' for the comparing model. The inspection requirement for this entity is as follows;
generate discretized region of B's faces as a set of points PBi (i = 1, 2, 3, ... ) with the specified density.
search for the nearest point PAi on A's faces from each point PBi, and calculate the distance Di between PAi and PBi.
compare the distance Di with the given threshold.
if Di exceeds the threshold, report a pair of points as ( PAi, PBi ).
repeat the above process by switching A and B.
NOTE 1 This process is depicted in Figure 2.
Evaluation of the distance between surfaces
NOTE 2 For robust finding of the nearest point at the area close to the boundary of A, outward extension of the underlying geometry of A with some extent is required. This algorithm is not described here, but will be given by a commercial software.
NOTE 3 The target data type connected_face_set accepts partial or entire domain of B-rep model and surface model.
numerical test to check if the distance of the corresponding two points is larger than the threshold.

a tolerance of
type for use in the discretization of , which sets an upper limit of the spatial distances between discretized points.
type name of the comparison target product data shall be etns_connected_face_set.
type name of the other comparison target product data shall be etns_connected_face_set.
type name of inspected value shall be mdns_length_measure. The inspected value according to this criterion shows the distance between two corresponding points.
type name of detected difference shall be either ddns_cartesian_point or ddns_point_on_surface. The detected difference according to this criterion is calculated for each .

type name of accuracy shall be atns_length_measure. The accuracy is used to calculate the nearest point on a
from a discretized point.

The
of
of this entity shall be of type
and its numerical value shall be of type specified by the measured_data_type attribute.

A Mismatch_of_arcwise_connected_surfaces_boundary is a type of
which detects the difference between boundary edges of the two compared s, where the boundary edges mean the external boundary edges which are refered only once from a
of the . Here, `A' stands for the compared model and `B' for the comparing model. The inspection requirement for this entity is as follows;
generate discretized region of external boundary edges of B's faces as a set of points PBi (i = 1, 2, 3, ... ) with the specified density.
search for the nearest point PAi on the boundary edges of A's faces from each point PBi, and calculate the distance Di between PAi and PBi.
compare the distance Di with the given threshold.
if Di exceeds the threshold, report a pair of points as ( PAi, PBi ).
repeat the above process by switching A and B.
The target data type connected_face_set accepts partial or entire domain of B-rep model and surface model as an open shell, which has 2-manifold domain except for the external boundary edges.
numerical test to check if the distance of the two corresponding points is larger than the threshold.

a tolerance of
type for use in the discretization of the boundary edges of , which sets an upper limit of the spatial distances between discretized points.
type name of the comparison target product data shall be etns_connected_face_set.
type name of the other comparison target product data shall be etns_connected_face_set.
type name of inspected value shall be mdns_length_measure. The inspected value according to this criterion shows the distance between two corresponding points.
type name of detected difference shall be ddns_cartesian_point or ddns_point_on_curve. The detected difference according to this criterion is calculated for boundary edges of each .

type name of accuracy shall be atns_length_measure. The accuracy is used to calculate the nearest point on a
from a discretized point.

The
of
of this entity shall be of type
and its numerical value shall be of type specified by the measured_data_type attribute.

A Mismatch_of_edges is a type of
for detecting non-corresponding s between s at the same location.
Here, `A' stands for the compared model and `B' for the comparing model. As for the correspondence of s, A's s may be spatially overlap with B's s in some cases, and in other cases, A's s may have no overlap with B's s. The inspection requirement corresponding to this entity is as follows;
generate discretized regions for each edge of A and B.
for each edge of A, say EA1, search for corresponding edge in B, say EB1, based on the specification given by , where EA1's discretized region matches with EB1 domain, and also EB1's discretized region matches with EA1 domain. The result of the correspondence matching is classified as follows.
Case-E1: one-by-one: "exact match", where two single edges EA1 and EB1 entirely match, then record an edge pair { EA1 : EB1 }.
Case-E2A: one-by-plural: "split edge", where EA1's discretized region matches entirely with EB1 and its adjacent edges, EB2, EB3, etc., then record an edge pair { EA1 : ( EB1 EB2 EB3 ... ) }.
Case-E2B: plural-by-one: "merged edge", where EB1's discretized region matches entirely with EA1 and its adjacent edges, EA2, EA3, etc., then record an edge pair { ( EA1 EA2 EA3 ... ) : EB1 }.
Case-E3: plural-by-plural: "compound edge", then record an edge pair { ( EA1 EA2 EA3 ... ) : ( EB1 EB2 EB3 ... ) }.
Case-E4A: one-by-none: "removed edge", where no edges of B match with EA1 at the same location, then record an edge pair { EA1 : ( none ) }.
Case-E4B: none-by-one: "added edge", where no edges of A match with EB1 at the same location, then record an edge pair { ( none ) : EB1 ) }.
When the cases E2A, E2B and E3 are detected, it is judged that two s have mismatch of edges.
NOTE 1 It is assumed that the correspondence between two models shall be properly calculated by application softwares.
NOTE 2 The above classification is depicted in Figure 3. Here, vertex and edge are symbolized as a circle and a line, respectively.
Classification of edge data structure matching
logical test to check whether the two s have mismatched edges or not.
type name of the comparison target product data shall be etns_connected_edge_set.
type name of inspected value shall be mdns_boolean_value. The inspected value according to this criterion is TRUE, if mismatched edges between the compared model and the comparing model are detected.
type name of detected difference shall be either ddns_edge or ddns_several_edges.
no accuracy is associated with this criterion.

A Mismatch_of_faces is a type of
for detecting non-corresponding s between s at the same location.
Here, `A' stands for the compared model and `B' for the comparing model. As for the correspondence of s, A's s may be spatially overlap with B's s in some cases, and in other cases, A's s may have no overlap with B's s. The inspection requirement corresponding to this entity is as follows;
generate discretized regions for each face of A and B.
for each face of A, say FA1, search for corresponding face in B, say FB1, based on the specification given by , where FA1's discretized region matches with FB1 domain, and also FB1's discretized region matches with FA1 domain. The result of the correspondence matching is classified as follows.
Case-1: one-by-one: "exact match", where two single faces FA1 and FB1 entirely match, then record a face pair { FA1 : FB1 }.
Case-2A: one-by-plural: "split face", where FA1's discretized region matches entirely with FB1 and its adjacent faces, FB2, FB3, etc., then record a face pair { FA1 : ( FB1 FB2 FB3 ... ) }.
Case-2B: plural-by-one: "merged face", where FB1's discretized region matches entirely with FA1 and its adjacent faces, FA2, FA3, etc., then record a face pair { ( FA1 FA2 FA3 ... ) : FB1 }.
Case-3: plural-by-plural: "compound face", then record a face pair { ( FA1 FA2 FA3 ... ) : ( FB1 FB2 FB3 ... ) }.
Case-4A: one-by-none: "removed face", where no faces of B match with FA1 at the same location, then record a face pair { FA1 : ( none ) }.
Case-4B: none-by-one: "added face", where no faces of A match with FB1 at the same location, then record a face pair { ( none ) : FB1 ) }.
When the cases 2A, 2B and 3 are detected, it is judged that two s have mismatch of faces.
NOTE 1 The target data type connected_face_set accepts partial or entire domain of B-rep model and surface model.
NOTE 2 It is assumed that the correspondence between two models shall be properly calculated by application softwares.
NOTE 3 The above classification is depicted in Figure 4. Here, edge of face's loop is symbolized as a line.
Classification of face data structure matching
logical test to check whether the two s have mismatch of faces, or not.
type name of the comparison target product data shall be etns_connected_face_set.
type name of inspected value shall be mdns_boolean_value. The inspected value according to this criterion is TRUE, if mismatched faces between the compared model and the comparing model are detected.
type name of detected difference shall be either ddns_face or ddns_several_faces.
no accuracy is associated with this criterion.

A Mismatch_of_point_cloud_and_related_geometry is a type of
which detects difference between a
and a
or . Here, `A' stands for the compared model and `B' for the comparing model. The inspection requirement for this entity is as follows;
choose a point PAi (i = 1, 2, 3, ... ) from the point-clouds data set A.
search the nearest point PBi on B's edges from each point PAi, and calculate the distance Di between PAi and PBi.
compare the distance Di with the given threshold.
if Di exceeds the threshold, report a pair of points as ( PAi, PBi ).
NOTE 1 The target data type connected_face_set accepts partial or entire domain of B-rep model and surface model.
NOTE 2 The target data connected_edge_set is expected to be constructed from B-rep, surface, or wireframe model.
numerical test to check if the distance of the two corresponding points is larger than the threshold.
type name of the comparison target product data shall be either etns_connected_edge_set or etns_connected_face_set.
type name of the other comparison target product data shall be etns_point_cloud_dataset.

type name of inspected value shall be mdns_length_measure. The inspected value according to this criterion shows the distance between a point of the
and the nearest point on the
or .
type name of detected difference shall be either ddns_cartesian_point, ddns_point_on_curve, or ddns_point_on_surface

type name of accuracy shall be atns_length_measure. The accuracy is used to calculate the nearest point on a
or
from a point of .

The
of
of this entity shall be of type
and its numerical value shall be of type specified by the measured_data_type attribute.

A Mismatch_of_points is a type of
which detects the different location between two compared s.
numerical test to check if the distance of two s is larger than the threshold.
type name of the comparison target product data shall be etns_vertex_point.
type name of the other comparison target product data shall be etns_vertex_point.
type name of inspected value shall be mdns_length_measure. The inspected value according to this criterion shows the distance between two s.
type name of detected difference shall be ddns_no_element. No detected difference according to this criterion is reported.
no accuracy is associated with this criterion.

The
of
of this entity shall be of type
and its numerical value shall be of type specified by the measured_data_type attribute.

A Mismatch_of_underlying_edge_geometry is a type of
which detects different underlying geometry data type of s for two topologically matched s. The inspection requirement corresponding to this entity is as follows;
obtain a report of
between two s (compared model is `A', and comparing model is `B').
choose a pair of corresponding faces of A and B. Here, FA is a set of A's faces, and FB is a set of B's faces in the faces-pair.
if the faces-pair is classified as "exact match", "split face", "merged face", or "compound face" (see, Case-1, 2A, 2B, or 3 in Figure 4), compare the edges in the faces, as follows;
for each edge of FA, say EA1, search for corresponding edge in FB, say FB1, based on the specification given by , where EA1's discretized region overlaps with EB1 domain, and also EB1's discretized region overlaps with EA1 domain.
if EA1 and EB1 are overlapping, compare the underlying geometry of EA1 and EB1.
if the underlying geometry does not match, the edges-pair (EA1, EB1) is reported.
repeat the above process for all of FA's edges.
repeat the above process for all the faces-pairs.
The target data type connected_face_set accepts partial or entire domain of B-rep model and surface model.
logical test to check whether the two corresponding s have different underlying geometry data types.
type name of the comparison target product data shall be etns_connected_face_set.
type name of the other comparison target product data shall be etns_connected_face_set.
type name of inspected value shall be mdns_boolean_value. The inspected value according to this criterion is TRUE, if different underlying geometry data type between corresponding s is detected.
type name of detected difference shall be ddns_edge.
no accuracy is associated with this criterion.

A Mismatch_of_underlying_face_geometry is a type of
which detects different underlying geometry data type of s for two topologically matched s. The inspection requirement corresponding to this entity is as follows;
obtain a report of
between two compared connected_face_set's.
choose a pair of corresponding faces.
if the faces-pair in the report is classified as "exact match", "split face", or "merged face" (see, Case-1, 2A, or 2B in Figure 4), compare the underlying geometry.
if the underlying geometry data type does not match, the faces-pair is reported.
repeat the above process for all the pairs.
The target data type connected_face_set accepts partial or entire domain of B-rep model and surface model.
logical test to check whether the two corresponding s have different underlying geometry data types.
type name of the comparison target product data shall be etns_connected_face_set.
type name of the other comparison target product data shall be etns_connected_face_set.
type name of inspected value shall be mdns_boolean_value. The inspected value according to this criterion is TRUE, if different underlying geometry data type between corresponding s is ditected.
type name of detected difference shall be ddns_face.
no accuracy is associated with this criterion.

A Missing_edge is a type of
for detecting missing or added s between s at the same location.
The inspection requirement corresponding to this entity is described in . Here, when the cases E4A and E4B are detected, it is judged that two s have missing faces.
logical test to check whether the two s have missing edges or not.
type name of the comparison target product data shall be etns_connected_edge_set.
type name of inspected value shall be mdns_boolean_value. The inspected value according to this criterion is TRUE, if mismatched edges between the compared model and the comparing model are detected.
type name of detected difference shall be either ddns_no_element or ddns_edge.
no accuracy is associated with this criterion.

A Missing_face is a type of
for detecting missing or added s between s at the same location.
The inspection requirement corresponding to this entity is described in . Here, when the cases 4A and 4B are detected, it is judged that two s have missing faces.
logical test to check whether the two s have missing faces or not.
type name of the comparison target product data shall be etns_connected_face_set.
type name of inspected value shall be mdns_boolean_value. The inspected value according to this criterion is TRUE, if mismatched faces between the compared model and the comparing model are detected.
type name of detected difference shall be either ddns_no_element or ddns_face.
no accuracy is associated with this criterion.
